column1: facts
Coffee contains caffeine that helps people stay alert.
Dogs are often called man's best friend.
The Eiffel Tower is located in Paris, France.
Smartphones typically need charging every day.
Pizza originated in Italy but is popular worldwide.
Exercise helps reduce stress and improve mood.
The internet connects billions of devices globally.
Water covers about 71% of Earth's surface.
Netflix produces original movies and TV shows.
Soccer is the most popular sport in the world.
Bitcoin is a type of digital cryptocurrency.
Chocolate is made from cacao beans.
Cars need regular maintenance to run efficiently.
Sunscreen protects skin from harmful UV rays.
Recycling helps reduce waste in landfills.
Airplanes are the fastest way to travel long distances.
Yoga combines physical postures with breathing techniques.
Social media platforms connect people across the globe.
Vaccines help prevent the spread of infectious diseases.
Cats purr when they are content or seeking comfort.
Amazon started as an online bookstore.
Rice is a staple food for over half the world's population.
Sleep is essential for physical and mental health.
The Great Wall of China is visible from space.
Honey never spoils and can last for centuries.
Disney owns Marvel, Star Wars, and Pixar.
Diamonds are formed under extreme pressure and heat.
Bananas are technically berries, while strawberries are not.
The human body is about 60% water.
Mount Everest is the highest mountain on Earth.
Penguins cannot fly but are excellent swimmers.
The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci.
Antibiotics fight bacterial infections but not viruses.
The Olympics are held every four years.
Avocados are high in healthy fats and nutrients.
The iPhone was first released in 2007.
Sharks have existed longer than trees on Earth.
Bees are responsible for pollinating many food crops.
The human brain can process images in just 13 milliseconds.
Elephants have the longest pregnancy of any land animal.
The Sahara is the largest hot desert in the world.
Sushi traditionally consists of vinegared rice with fish.
Lightning strikes the Earth about 8.6 million times per day.
Humans share about 98% of their DNA with chimpanzees.
The average person spends six months of their life waiting at traffic lights.
The first email was sent in 1971.
Laughter releases endorphins that make people feel good.
The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France.
Brushing teeth twice daily helps prevent cavities.
The average cloud weighs about 1.1 million pounds.
The Milky Way galaxy contains between 100-400 billion stars.
Light from the Sun takes about 8 minutes and 20 seconds to reach Earth.
A neutron star is so dense that a teaspoon of it would weigh about 10 million tons.
The Great Red Spot on Jupiter is a storm that has been raging for at least 400 years.
Venus rotates in the opposite direction compared to most planets in our solar system.
The human body contains enough carbon to make about 900 pencils.
A day on Mercury lasts about 176 Earth days.
The coldest natural temperature ever recorded on Earth was -128.6°F (-89.2°C) in Antarctica.
The universe is estimated to be about 13.8 billion years old.
Quantum entanglement allows particles to instantly affect each other regardless of distance.
The first computer programmer was a woman named Ada Lovelace.
The first computer bug was an actual moth found in a Harvard Mark II computer in 1947.
The average smartphone contains more computing power than the computers used for the Apollo 11 moon landing.
The world's first website was created by Tim Berners-Lee in 1991.
About 90% of the world's data has been created in the last two years.
The first computer mouse was made of wood.
The QWERTY keyboard layout was designed to slow typists down to prevent jamming on mechanical typewriters.
The first email was sent by Ray Tomlinson in 1971.
The most expensive domain name ever sold was Cars.com for $872 million.
Approximately 70% of all YouTube traffic comes from mobile devices.
The human heart beats about 100,000 times per day.
An adult human body contains approximately 100 trillion cells.
The smallest bone in the human body is the stapes in the middle ear.
Humans shed about 600,000 particles of skin every hour.
The human brain can process information as fast as 120 meters per second.
The strongest muscle in the human body relative to its size is the masseter (jaw muscle).
Human fingernails grow about four times faster than toenails.
The human body contains enough iron to make a 3-inch nail.
The average person will spend about six months of their life waiting at traffic lights.
The human nose can detect about 1 trillion different scents.
Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood.
Honey never spoils; archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old.
Koalas sleep up to 22 hours a day.
A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance.
Crows can recognize human faces and hold grudges against people who have threatened them.
Bees can recognize human faces.
A snail can sleep for three years at a time.
The fingerprints of koalas are so similar to humans that they have been confused at crime scenes.
Elephants are the only mammals that can't jump.
Polar bear fur is not white but actually transparent with a hollow core that reflects light.
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the invention of the iPhone than to the building of the Great Pyramid of Giza.
Oxford University is older than the Aztec Empire.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar in 1896, lasting only 38 minutes.
Ancient Romans used crushed mouse brains as toothpaste.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye, contrary to popular belief.
Napoleon was once attacked by thousands of rabbits when hunting.
Vikings used the bones of slain animals to make skis for winter travel.
The first recorded use of 'OMG' was in a 1917 letter to Winston Churchill.
Ketchup was sold as medicine in the 1830s to treat diarrhea and indigestion.
Ancient Egyptians used crocodile dung as a contraceptive.
Honey is the only food that doesn't spoil.
Apples float in water because they are 25% air.
The world's most expensive coffee, Kopi Luwak, comes from civet cat feces.
Carrots were originally purple, not orange.
Chocolate was once used as currency by the Aztecs.
The fear of cooking is called mageirocophobia.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not.
The most expensive pizza in the world costs $12,000 and takes 72 hours to make.
The red food dye carmine is made from crushed beetles.
A typical cup of coffee requires 140 liters of water to grow, process, and prepare.
The first Olympic Games were held in 776 BCE and featured only one event: a foot race.
The longest tennis match in history lasted for 11 hours and 5 minutes.
Golf balls typically have between 300 and 500 dimples.
The Olympic flag's five rings represent the five inhabited continents.
The Stanley Cup has been used as a cereal bowl, a flower pot, and a baptismal font.
The average MLB baseball lasts only 7 pitches before being replaced.
The first basketball hoops were actually peach baskets with the bottoms intact.
The longest boxing match in history lasted 110 rounds.
The first FIFA World Cup trophy was stolen in 1983 and never recovered.
The shortest player in NBA history was Muggsy Bogues at 5'3" (160 cm).
The Wilhelm Scream has been used in over 400 films and TV shows since 1951.
The highest-grossing film of all time adjusted for inflation is 'Gone with the Wind'.
Nintendo was founded in 1889 as a playing card company.
Michael Jackson patented a special shoe design that allowed him to lean forward at impossible angles.
The shortest performance to win an Oscar was Beatrice Straight's 5-minute, 40-second appearance in 'Network'.
The Simpsons is the longest-running American animated television series.
The first music video played on MTV was 'Video Killed the Radio Star' by The Buggles.
Sean Connery wore a toupee in all his James Bond movies.
The 'Happy Birthday' song was under copyright until 2016.
The original Monopoly game pieces were inspired by items on the designer's charm bracelet.
Alaska has more coastline than all of the other 49 U.S. states combined.
Russia has 11 time zones, the most of any country.
The driest place on Earth is the Atacama Desert in Chile, where some areas have never recorded rainfall.
Australia is the only continent without an active volcano.
The world's largest desert is Antarctica, not the Sahara.
Mt. Thor on Baffin Island, Canada, has the world's greatest vertical drop at 4,101 feet (1,250 meters).
Point Nemo in the Pacific Ocean is the most remote place on Earth, furthest from any land.
Istanbul is the only city in the world that spans two continents: Europe and Asia.
The Nile River flows north, not south like most rivers in the Northern Hemisphere.
Vatican City is the smallest country in the world at just 0.17 square miles.
The average person has about 60,000 thoughts per day.
The brain named itself.
Humans are the only animals that blush.
People are more creative in rooms with high ceilings.
The average person will spend about six months of their life waiting at red lights.
The 'doorway effect' explains why we forget what we were doing when we enter a new room.
Smelling rosemary can improve memory by up to 75%.
People who speak multiple languages can have different personalities in each language.
The average person makes about 35,000 decisions every day.
The human attention span has decreased from 12 seconds in 2000 to 8 seconds today.
Apple's first logo featured Isaac Newton sitting under an apple tree.
About 80% of millionaires are first-generation wealthy.
Walmart has a lower acceptance rate than Harvard (2.6% vs. 5.2%).
The average employee spends 13 hours per week on emails.
The IKEA catalog is printed in more copies than the Bible each year.
More than 80% of startups fail within their first three years.
The creator of the Nike swoosh logo was initially paid only $35 for the design.
The world's first trillionaire is expected to emerge within the next 25 years.
The most expensive coffee in the world costs over $600 per pound.
The longest word in English without repeating any letters is 'uncopyrightable'.
The dot over the letter 'i' is called a tittle.
The word 'set' has the most definitions in the English language.
The most commonly used letter in English is 'e'.
The least used letter in English is 'q'.
There are more than 200 artificial languages that have been invented for books, movies, and TV shows.
The word 'goodbye' is a contraction of 'God be with ye'.
The first text message ever sent was 'Merry Christmas' in 1992.
About 7% of American adults believe that chocolate milk comes from brown cows.
The word 'nerd' was first coined by Dr. Seuss in his book 'If I Ran the Zoo'.
Leonardo da Vinci could write with one hand and draw with the other simultaneously.
The Mona Lisa has no eyebrows; it was the fashion in Renaissance Florence to shave them off.
Vincent van Gogh only sold one painting during his lifetime.
Pablo Picasso's full name has 23 words.
The color wheel was invented by Sir Isaac Newton.
The world's oldest known musical instrument is a flute made from a vulture's wing bone.
The Statue of Liberty was originally designed for Egypt.
Michelangelo painted the Sistine Chapel lying on his back for four years.
The first feature-length animated movie was Disney's Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs.
The tradition of wedding rings comes from ancient Egypt.
In Alabama, it's illegal to drive blindfolded.
In France, it's illegal to name a pig 'Napoleon'.
In Switzerland, it's illegal to flush the toilet after 10 PM if you live in an apartment.
In Singapore, chewing gum is banned except for therapeutic purposes.
In Thailand, it's illegal to step on money because it bears the image of the king.
In Victoria, Australia, only licensed electricians are legally allowed to change a light bulb.
In Eureka, Nevada, it's illegal for men with mustaches to kiss women.
In Oklahoma, it's illegal to take a bite of someone else's hamburger.
In Scotland, if someone knocks on your door and needs to use the toilet, you must let them in by law.
In Milan, Italy, it's a legal requirement to smile at all times except during funerals or hospital visits.
Humans are the only animals with chins.
The average person produces enough saliva in their lifetime to fill two swimming pools.
Your eyes blink around 20 times per minute, which adds up to over 10 million times per year.
The human skeleton renews itself completely every 10 years.
The acid in your stomach is strong enough to dissolve razor blades.
Humans are the only species known to blush.
The average person walks the equivalent of three times around the world in a lifetime.
The human eye can distinguish between approximately 10 million different colors.
Your brain uses 20% of the total oxygen in your body.
The average human produces about 25,000 quarts of saliva in a lifetime.
The microwave oven was invented after a researcher walked by a radar tube and a chocolate bar melted in his pocket.
The chainsaw was originally invented for childbirth, not cutting wood.
The first alarm clock could only ring at 4 a.m.
Bubble wrap was originally designed as wallpaper.
The pacemaker was invented by accident when an engineer was trying to record heart sounds.
The Slinky was created when a naval engineer accidentally knocked a spring off his desk.
Coca-Cola was originally invented as a cure for morphine addiction.
The frisbee was inspired by pie tins from the Frisbie Baking Company that college students would throw around.
Play-Doh was originally created as a wallpaper cleaner.
Super Glue was discovered by accident during research for clear plastic gun sights in World War II.
A jiffy is an actual unit of time: 1/100th of a second.
The average person will spend six months of their life waiting at red lights.
A group of pandas is called an embarrassment.
The shortest commercial flight in the world lasts only 1.7 minutes.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
The inventor of the Pringles can is buried in one.
The world's oldest known living tree is over 5,000 years old.
A bolt of lightning contains enough energy to toast 100,000 slices of bread.
Cows have best friends and get stressed when separated from them.
The total weight of all the ants on Earth is roughly equal to the total weight of all humans.
The world's oldest piece of chewing gum is 9,000 years old.
A group of unicorns is called a blessing.
The Hawaiian alphabet has only 12 letters.
A flock of crows is called a murder.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't.
The average person walks the equivalent of five times around the world in their lifetime.
Dolphins have names for each other and can call each other by specific whistles.
A day on Mercury is longer than its year.
The first oranges weren't orange – they were green.
The longest hiccuping spell lasted 68 years.
A blue whale's heart is so big that a human could swim through its arteries.
The world's oldest hotel has been operating since 705 AD in Japan.
The shortest war in history lasted 38 minutes between Britain and Zanzibar in 1896.
Cats can make over 100 vocal sounds, while dogs can only make about 10.
The fingerprints of koalas are virtually indistinguishable from human fingerprints.
The total number of possible chess games exceeds the number of atoms in the universe.
The word 'nerd' was first coined by Dr. Seuss in 'If I Ran the Zoo'.
The longest word in English without a vowel is 'rhythms'.
The average person spends two weeks of their life waiting at traffic lights.
The Great Barrier Reef is the largest living structure on Earth.
A group of owls is called a parliament.
The fear of long words is called hippopotomonstrosesquippedaliophobia.
The inventor of the frisbee was cremated and made into frisbees after his death.
The longest place name in the world is in New Zealand and has 85 letters.
